metadata.title: CVE-2022-1868 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Inappropriate implementation in Extensions API in Google Chrome prior to102.0.5005.61 allowed an attacker who convinced a user to install amalicious extension to bypass navigation restrictions via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1868` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 103.0.5060.134-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 103.0.5060.134-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 103.0.5060.134-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 103.0.5060.134-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 103.0.5060.134-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '103.0.5060.134-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
